title: Allan Ellis (rugby league)
text:
Charles Allan Ellis (1909–1984) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1930s and 1940s.
Background.
Ellis was born in <a href="Marrickville%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Marrickville, New South Wales</a> on 7 May 1909.
Playing career.
Ellis joined the <a href="Newtown%20Jets">Newtown</a> club, playing six first grade seasons with the club between 1935 and 1940. He also captained the club in his final seasons. 
He is the brother of two other <a href="Newtown%20Jets">Newtown</a> legends; <a href="Keith%20Ellis%20%28rugby%20league%29">Keith Ellis</a> and <a href="Tom%20Ellis%20%28rugby%20league%29">Tom Ellis</a>. 
Coaching career.
As his brothers did before him, Ellis coached the lower grades at Newtown for many years, including winning a third grade premiership in 1943. He later coached the first grade team between 1962 and 1965. His son, <a href="Greg%20Ellis%20%28rugby%20league%29">Greg Ellis</a>, also played first grade with the <a href="Newtown%20Jets">Newtown</a> in the 1950s and 1960s.
Ellis died on 23 September 1984, aged 75.
